## Portfolio Beta and Cost of Capital A two-asset portfolio invests **45**% in Asset A (β = 0.84) and **55**% in Asset B (β = 0.96). Compute the **portfolio beta**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ **Aggregation rule:** Portfolio beta is the **value-weighted average** of component betas: βp = Σ wiβi. **Your numbers:** 45%×0.84 + 55%×0.96 (scaled to weights) → **0.906**.
::: With **Rf = 2.9**% and **Rm = 10.3**%, compute the portfolio’s **cost of capital via CAPM**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ **CAPM logic:** Required return rises with **systematic risk** (β). E[Rp] = Rf + βp(Rm − Rf) = **9.6%**. Interpretation: this is the portfolio’s **opportunity cost of capital**.
:::
